intro: Poa annua var. pilantha, commonly known as slender annual bluegrass, is a cool-season grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its fine, dark green blades and tufted growth habit, often forming dense mats in disturbed soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale blue to greenish flowers. It is commonly found in lawns, roadsides, and agricultural fields due to its adaptability and rapid growth. Its botanical features make it a useful species for erosion control and turfgrass management.
